quote.msg: 有無人教下map reading可以點做得快又啱 好驚map reading

replies.msg:
1. Measure areaaaaa
通常map-reading textbook書會叫你畫1cm*1cm格仔，我一直都係咁都幾準，study leave行文具舖見到有佈滿0.5cm*0.5cm格仔嘅間尺，有成30cm長，做快咗20秒咁

2. Conventional Signssss
背晒啲signs，除咗設施(hospital vs clinic，school vs library，社區中心vs廁所)之前仲要記natural landscape，以1:20000嚟講山上面綠色係 woodland，白色係grassland，好多人錯要小心
特別記住 swamp 同 mangrove 喺1:20000同1:5000係唔同。

3. Gradientttttt
記格式，除咗1:xxx，仲有1 in xxxx
Height係數contour line搵，distance用紙邊/繩度再×個scale搵actual distance
要搵個xxx係咩老師通常教height÷distance，然後「1÷ANS」去搵答案，其實一開波直接distance÷height就得
計一條路road / footpath嘅長度時，記住用紙邊度，唔係求其用條直線連起兩點就算

4. 晝Cross sectionnnnnn
寫標題「Cross-section showing (抄題目)」有兩條y-axis，做好晒2條y-axis同埋一條x-axis嘅所有label，雖然條線你係一點點mark上去但唔好用間尺連起所有點，彎彎哋咁畫


5. Intervisible????
畫條直線穿過題目問你嗰2個grid reference，之後睇中間有冇一條contour line代表嘅高度係高過2個grid reference入面矮啲嗰個，冇就intervisible，最易

6. Bearinggggggg
睇清楚題目問你whole-circle bearing、reduced bearing定係compass point，如果問from A to B，記得個座標要畫喺個from上面(A)，再畫條直線去B

7. Transacttttt (好似已經好少見，得閒先睇)
畫條直線穿過題目問你嗰2個grid reference，之後睇 land use

大致係咁，利申map-reading啱晒

其實好高難度
睇過老師先有得睇嘅地理科dse報告

強帖留名
Electives 揀岩石定氣候好

climate
-ve:
->long-term: accelerate physical chemical weathering->more weathered mass/loose rocks
->short-term: rain splash action/lubricating effect/excessive moisture content of soil reduces soil cohesiveness/soil erosion+self-weight of water also have negative impact on slope stability

+ve
->sufficient rainfall->more vegetation->tree root stabilisation
->foliage->reduce rain splash action/increase interception to reduce surface runoff

urban development:
with good urban planning
- geotechnical engineering: e.g. retaining wall/shotcrete
- prevention of indiscriminate tree felling
- protection of natural stream courses to reduce flooding
-> the combination of all the above can increase stability

bad urban planning: vice versa

urban development:
with good urban planning
- geotechnical engineering: e.g. retaining wall/shotcrete
- prevention of indiscriminate tree felling
- protection of natural stream courses to reduce flooding
-> the combination of all the above can increase stability

bad urban planning: vice versa
